lenders.name: FIU Micro Lenders Corp
lenders.loan_because:
The FIU Micro Lenders, a new student organizing committee at Florida International University, as well as a non-profit 501c3 Florida corporation is committed to helping fight global poverty. Via mutually beneficial partnerships with local businesses, fund-raising efforts, and encouraging microfinance education for FIU's students they seek to provide tools for everyone to make their own contribution to a better world. 

We will continue to forge partnerships within our community, raise awareness of the powerful force of microfinance, and redefine what it means to be an International Business student.

For more information or to join your energies to our fight, please email us at:

fiumicrolenders@gmail.com
Second Kiva page at:
http://www.kiva.org/lender/fiumicrolenders
lenders.occupational_info: We are International Business students enrolled at Florida International University.

lenders.name: Faye
lenders.loan_because: I have been blessed during my life and want to share with someone less fortunate than me.  I want to make a difference in someone's life.
lenders.occupational_info: A paralegal works with barristers or lawyers to get justice for those who have been harmed or injured by the wrongful actions of another person or company.

lenders.name: keith
lenders.loan_because: I enjoy helping people out. It makes me feel good I mean real good
lenders.occupational_info: I do x-rays at the public hospital (we deal mostly with the poor so their is some free health care here in the good old USA)

lenders.name: Stephannie
lenders.loan_because:
it is empowering as a hand-up.
We find it important to give to others in any way that we can.  We are blessed to have so much more than most.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a high school teacher, and my son is a student at 16 :)

lenders.name: Barbara
lenders.loan_because: It's that principle, give a man a fish and he eats today; teach a man to fish and he'll feed his whole village.  I want to enable a lot of people to eat fish :)

lenders.loan_because: I enjoy watching the expansion of people's business'. I am grateful they have the opportunity to grow.

lenders.name: Jessica
lenders.loan_because: I love the entrepreneurial spirit!
lenders.occupational_info: Colorful

lenders.name: prince
lenders.loan_because: want to start a business like poltry farm. want to help poor people by giving them job.
lenders.occupational_info:
my total plan is in different phases.
my first phase is to start with a poltry farm. which requires a machine which costs 1400 usd. i will finance half of it and reqires loan half of it.
in my secound phase i will start a dairy farm.
in my last phase i want to start a big company of processing powder milk.

lenders.name: Jonathan
lenders.loan_because: It's a neat way to expand my philanthropy to a more personal level.

lenders.name: Stephanie
lenders.loan_because: I am inspired by my mother who started her first business as a minority in the US and single mother of 3.   She is now the most successful person I know, in every way.  She taught me to be successful too and now I want to pass whatever blessings I am able to on to as many people I can.
lenders.occupational_info: I own a yoga studio in downtown los angeles (across the street from world known landmark- The Disney Concert Hall).  I also own a coaching seminar business and television production company with my husband.  Most importantly I am pregnant with twin girls.

lenders.name: Sandra
lenders.loan_because: I've been without before - I've been blessed with enough and then some now.  It is God's commandment that those to whom much is given, much is expected.

lenders.name: Cathryn
lenders.loan_because: my husband and i are both disabled. we receive benefits from uncle sam and live a frugal life. we are so grateful for what we have and wanted to share. we are very lucky to have what we have and live in a country which takes care of it's disabled people. we want to give back what we can to someone who is working to make thier business succeed to improve their lives.
lenders.occupational_info: i am a home-maker, my husband is an artist.

lenders.loan_because: it gives me joy and purpose to pass on my blessings from God to others who in turn plant their own seeds of love and self-reliance.

lenders.name: Samantha
lenders.loan_because: I believe in micofinancing, regardless of how economically advantageous it is to prosperous countries. I say that because as we've learned so painfully, just because you are a developed country doesn't mean that your banking systems are sound or moral. Just because something "works" one day doesn't mean it will the next (i.e. hedge funds). I just want deserving people to be able to borrow money and make a living, period.

lenders.name: Mary
lenders.loan_because: I want to support and encourage people who wish to move toward self sufficiency.  I admire those who have an entrepreneurial spirit.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with organizations and individuals to improve their leadership and management skills through workshops and individual coaching.

lenders.name: Drew
lenders.loan_because: It is a small way to make a big difference!
lenders.occupational_info: Working in a local church where we are attempting to follow Jesus, change our community and impact the world.

lenders.name: Beverly & Sonny
lenders.loan_because: God has blessed us and we want to share these blessings.
lenders.occupational_info: I do loans for home purchases and my husband is a retired truck driver.

lenders.name: Robert
lenders.loan_because: I know what it is like to start your own business.

lenders.name: Donna
lenders.loan_because: I want to help in some way!

lenders.name: Barbara
lenders.loan_because: While I don't have much, God has blessed me tremendously and I want to share these blessings with those in need who are trying to make a living for their families. Working with my husband in his computer consulting business, I know the difficulties that come with owning and running your own business and trying to make it a success.
lenders.occupational_info: The work I perform in my husband's business includes the majority of the administrative office duties.

lenders.name: Lynda
lenders.loan_because: I constantly hear or see all the horror, poverty, etc. in the world. I have this overwhelming desire to help, assist in some way, GIVEBACK. I wanted to stop being one of those who talks about it and is doing something about it. Kiva is a phenomenal concept that allows one to do this and I am blessed to have gained knowledge of it so I can do my part.
lenders.occupational_info: Busy, busy, busy :-) Not enough hours in a day. I work in Music Publishing so it is a gift to be around what I love most, music! I am also a Student completing my degree in Sociology, so I hope to go onto Law School in the next few years and go into Criminal or Family Law.

lenders.name: Marg
lenders.loan_because: I can.

I use photography to help people show the world how they want to be seen.

lenders.occupational_info: I attend university and study Spanish and Women's studies.

lenders.name: Rita
lenders.loan_because: I am an entrepreneur and I understand some of the difficulties involved in manifesting my dreams. I hope that the sale of my works which fund me will also help others fulfill their goals too.
lenders.occupational_info:
I am an artist who builds treasure chests.  Each is 
Created with the belief that everyone should have a beautiful, unique and special place to keep the things they treasure...something visible and alive, becoming part of your story. Each is always unique & handmade with an element reminding us that we are all connected and part of something bigger. For example, the treasure boxes are all the same on the inside - just as we are all very different on the outside but consist of the same elements within.

lenders.name: Brenda
lenders.loan_because: I just want to help people who are trying to improve their lives. It can take just a little from us to make a big difference in another human beings life.
lenders.occupational_info: I am blessed to live in a country where I am afforded the opportunity to do whatever I want to do, to have the freedom to have a job and to be able to take care of my family. I hope that my getting involved with Kiva can make someone elses life better.

lenders.name: SP Business Students

lenders.occupational_info: We are a group of business students from Saint Paul High School in Niagara Falls studying international business, entrepreneurship and accounting.

lenders.name: Jen
lenders.loan_because: I don't believe in charity. I believe in solidarity. Charity is so vertical. It goes from the top to the bottom. Solidarity is horizontal. It respects the other person and learns from the other. I have a lot to learn from other people. - Eduardo Galeano

lenders.name: Frederic
lenders.loan_because: I feel it is investing in my family, the human race!

lenders.loan_because: What a wonderful opportunity!  I am overseas with the Military and saw Oprah on AFN and could not go to bed with out helping someone in need!  I believe my family and I are getting just as much out of this as the person we are helping somewhere in the world!
lenders.occupational_info: I am a full time mom and student working towards my Bachlor degree in Education!  I have two more years of college before I become a teacher!

Micro-financing is an innovative idea in the fight against poverty. We need more ideas like this one.  It just feels good to help someone help themself!

lenders.loan_because: I would like to help others in ways that I can

lenders.loan_because: Feels great! It's simple - people helping people.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for a government agency that helps adults, children, the elderly and disabled.

lenders.name: Oak
lenders.loan_because: Life is so much harder in other parts of the world.  I want to help better another person's life, by giving them the opportunity to help themselves.  I feel fortunate to be able to help in my small way.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a wife,  mother of 2 young girls, and a Registered Nurse.

lenders.occupational_info: I help companies simplify complicated websites and make it easier for people to find information they need.

lenders.name: Becky

lenders.loan_because: I've been given so much in life. It's my responsibility to my fellow man (& woman) to give something in return. To those whom much has been given, much is expected...
lenders.occupational_info: I teach young children (6-8 years old) how to read, write, understand the way numbers work together. But more important, I teach them to treat every human with dignity and respect.

lenders.name: Jack
lenders.loan_because: Global development is a process that involves a two-pronged approach. Large corporations can have positive effects in the communities and areas where they operate (and yes, they can have negative effects, too, which is the risk of working in an imperfect system), but the reality is that even in the best of situations, the "trickle down" results of top-down development only reaches about 80-85% of any given population. The remaining 15-20% matter just as much as the top. That's why I give: I understand that there needs to be a bottom-up, grassroots effort to compensate for the shortcomings of traditional economics, and I know I am able to be a part of it. My faith calls me to respond to the needs of people in the world, and Kiva is a great way to help me live out what I believe is ultimately Christ's call in my life and the lives of those who follow him: Love God, love others.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm a teacher by training, and as a youth pastor I get to teach kids something I'm passionate about besides literature: God's love and our response to that love. I'm also hoping to apply my education to some very important development work that is going to need to take place in southern Africa in the very near future.

lenders.name: Carol

lenders.occupational_info: Manage a wide area network for a global corporation.

The ability to see the people and read about their backgrounds and goals makes the effort more tangible.  We wish all of the participants the best of luck, and hope that this approach to improving the lives of others continues for a long time to come.
lenders.occupational_info: Our job is fun, tiring, stressful, unpredictable  and neccessary.

lenders.name: Dora
lenders.loan_because: I believe everyone in this world deserves a chance. This is a wonderful way to give back. Giving makes me feel good! We are making a BIG difference in these people's lives across the world. We are giving them not only a loan, but a feeling of hope and a feeling of accomplishment and success.
lenders.occupational_info:
I am a full time artist.
I paint with encaustic and oil sticks. I’m inspired by the bold  and bright colors that you see while walking around my native Buenos Aires, Argentina. 

During the summers I work with children. I own and run a summer camp along with another teachers in the city of Philadelphia.

lenders.name: Debbie

lenders.name: Mary Ann
lenders.loan_because: There were times when I needed help, and I got it. Now, it's my turn to "pay it forward."
lenders.occupational_info: I write young adult and suspense books, and several of my short stories have been published.

lenders.name: Kimberly
lenders.loan_because: I am able.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach in a homeschooling co-op 2 days per week in my home. The children are ages 2 1/2 to 6 years old. One of my students is my daughter. I seek to give them a better understanding of the world and teach practical knowledge of many subjects.
